The "Pure Land" is an area said to exist around all the Buddhas where it is most condusive to achieving enlightenment. In the Pure Land Sutras, there are mentions of many types of birds and blossoms of flowers with wonderous fragrance which can bring instant enlightenment.
The lotus because it grows out of the muddy water and blossoms at the surface has long symbolized enlightenment.
The Larger Amida Sutra talks of sounds from a pipe that brings instant enlightenment to those that hear it.
The Larger Amida Sutra depicts sweet fruit with wonderous taste that can bring enlightement to those that eat it. The Japanese imagined it to be peaches.

Songs had always been important to Jodo Shinshu. Shinran Shonin created the melody for the "Ondokusan" which is still sung today. The first Jodo Shinshu ministers to the US reported on the use of organ and western music in protestant services. After that the Honganji hired composers to compose new arrangements and songs.
